intro: Urera usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambara urera, is a flowering plant native to the montane forests of East Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an understory shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
